definition[0]: to add something to what you are selling, without increasing the price
example[0]: We paid $2,000 for the boat, with the trailer and spares thrown in.
definition[1]: if you throw in a remark, you say it suddenly without thinking carefully
example[1]: She threw in a couple of odd remarks about men.
definition[2]: to admit that you have been defeated
definition[3]: an action in which someone throws the ball back onto the field in a game of football
